TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed EventOpcode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the standard operation codes that the event source attaches to events.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the EventOpcode class to specify event operation codes. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource> class.
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.diagnostics.tra_5_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.diagnostics.tra_5_1.cs)]
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.diagnostics.tra_5_2.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.diagnostics.tra_5_2.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode DataCollectionStart = int32(3)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode DataCollectionStop = int32(4)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode Extension = int32(5)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode Info = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode Receive = int32(240)

Docs.summary: An event that is published when one activity in an application receives data.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode Reply = int32(6)

Docs.summary: An event that is published after an activity in an application replies to an event.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode Resume = int32(7)

Docs.summary: An event that is published after an activity in an application resumes from a suspended state. The event should follow an event that has the Suspend operation code.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode Send = int32(9)

Docs.summary: An event that is published when one activity in an application transfers data or system resources to another activity.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode Start = int32(1)

Docs.summary: An event that is published when an application starts a new transaction or activity. This operation code can be embedded within another transaction or activity when multiple events that have the Start code follow each other without an intervening event that has a Stop code.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Start field to specify a start operation. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource> class.
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.diagnostics.tra_5_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.diagnostics.tra_5_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode Stop = int32(2)

Docs.summary: An event that is published when an activity or a transaction in an application ends. The event corresponds to the last unpaired event that has a Start operation code.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Stop field to specify a stop operation. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource> class.
[!code-vb[ETWTrace#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.diagnostics.tra_5_2.vb)] [!code-cs[ETWTrace#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.diagnostics.tra_5_2.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventOpcode Suspend = int32(8)

Docs.summary: An event that is published when an activity in an application is suspended.
